title: Here's a curated list of 20 articles up to 2023 that focus on summarizing written and spoken conversations. These articles cover various aspects of the topic, including methodologies, applications
note: and advancements in natural language processing (NLP) and machine learning.

title: Pre-training of Deep Bidirectional Transformers for Language Understanding"** - Devlin et al
This paper introduces BERT, a model that has significantly influenced text summarization techniques
Pre-training with Extracted Gap-sentences for Abstractive Summarization"** - Zhang et al
Discusses a model specifically designed for abstractive summarization tasks
**"Text Summarization Techniques: A Brief Survey"**
Provides an overview of various text summarization techniques
**"A Survey on Text Summarization Extractive Techniques"**
Focuses on extractive summarization methods
**"Abstractive Text Summarization using Sequence-to-Sequence RNNs and Beyond"**
Explores the use of RNNs for abstractive summarization
**"Neural Abstractive Text Summarization with Sequence-to-Sequence Models"** - Nallapati et al
Discusses the application of sequence-to-sequence models in summarization
Introduces a model that combines the benefits of both extractive and abstractive summarization
**"Hierarchical Attention Networks for Document Classification"** - Yang et al
While focused on classification, the hierarchical attention mechanism is relevant for summarization
**"A Deep Reinforced Model for Abstractive Summarization"** - Paulus et al
Combines reinforcement learning with neural networks for summarization
**"XLNet: Generalized Autoregressive Pretraining for Language Understanding"** - Yang et al
XLNet's capabilities are relevant for improving summarization models
**"Towards Abstractive Summarization Using Semantic Representations"** - Liu et al
Discusses the use of semantic representations in summarization
**"Leveraging Pre-trained Checkpoints for Sequence Generation Tasks"**
Examines the use of pre-trained models for tasks including summarization

container-title: **"Discourse-Aware Neural Extractive Text Summarization"** - Xu et al

title: Focuses on incorporating discourse information into extractive summarization
**"DialogLM: Pre-trained Model for Long Dialogue Summarization"** - Zhang et al
Introduces a model specifically for summarizing long dialogues
**"Summarizing Dialogues with Neural Networks"**
Discusses neural network approaches for dialogue summarization
**"Towards Conversational Speech Recognition and Summarization"** - Xiong et al
Explores methods for recognizing and summarizing spoken conversations

container-title: **"End-to-End Neural Meeting Summarization with Pre-trained Transformers"** - Zhang et al

title: Focuses on summarizing meeting transcripts using transformer models
**"Speech Summarization Using Deep Learning"** - Hori et al
Discusses deep learning approaches for summarizing spoken content
**"Automatic Speech Summarization: A Survey"** - Mehdad et al
Provides an overview of techniques for summarizing spoken language
**"Summarizing Spoken and Written Conversations"**
A comprehensive study on summarizing both spoken and written conversations
These articles should provide a solid foundation for understanding the current state of research and development in the field of summarizing written and spoken conversations
